comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b8) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b8
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b8) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b8

the first line of the search result doesn't appear to be rendered correctly - oversized brackets which spill over on to the line above - is this correct



Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. go to http://www.google.co.uk/search?q=lego+universe+where+is+nexus+j&ie=utf-8&oe=utf-8&aq=t&rls=org.mozilla:en-GB:official&client=firefox-a#sclient=psy&hl=en&safe=active&client=firefox-a&rls=org.mozilla:en-GB%3Aofficial&q=where+can+i+find+nexus+jay+mp3+drug&aq=f&aqi=&aql=&oq=&gs_rfai=&pbx=1&fp=19bff151c0ba26e
2. look at first line of search results
Actual Results:  
brackets appear to be triple height

Expected Results:  
single height brackets characters

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b9pre) Gecko/20110104 Firefox/4.0b9pre

Able to reproduce. The right side bracket is oversized than that of left size bracket.

comments.raw_text:
Is this still an Issue using Firefox 4 final Version?

For me it looks like Comment 1 describes. Opera 11 is rendering like mentioned in Comment 2 with the right Bracket being oversized.

Can this be a Internationalization/Layout Text Core Bug?
comments.text:

comments.text:
Still an "issue" with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110628 Firefox/7.0a1 ID:20110628030753

It is now the 2nd result.

Kicking to Core -> Layout:Text for further input

comments.raw_text: I don't see anything like what's described in comment 1 or 2. Possibly I'm getting different search results than the report refers to. Could someone who sees this issue provide a (minimized and) _persistent_ testcase, please? A screenshot might be nice, too.
